item.title: Community sustainability in Wikipedia a review of research and initiatives
item.description:
Description

PyData SF 2016

Wikipedia relies on one of the worldâ€™s largest open collaboration communities. Since 2001, the community has grown substantially and faced many challenges. This presentation reviews research and initiatives around community sustainability in Wikipedia that are relevant for many open source projects, including issues of newcomer retention, governance, automated moderation, and marginalized groups.
item.dc:creator: Stuart Geiger

item.title: Governing Open Source Projects at Scale: Lessons from Wikipedia's Growing Pains
item.dc:creator: Stuart Geiger
